author: Not available
source: The Complete Corpus of Anglo-Saxon Poetry

text.3: Wæs he under hiofenum      hearpera mærost
text.4: ðara we an folcum      gefrigen hæbben.
text.5: Sangere he wæs soðfæstest,      swiðe geðancol
text.8: Wæs se dryhtnes ðiowa      Dauid æt wige
text.12: Hweðere him geiode,      swa ful oft gedeð
text.15: Gelamp þæt him mon ansende      saula neriend,
text.19: þæt se fruma wære      his feores sceldig,
text.20: for ðam þe he Uriam het      aldre beneman,
text.22: and him Bezabe      brohte to wife
text.23: for gitsunga,      þe he godes eorre
text.24: þurh his selfes weorc      sona anfunde.
text.26: Dauid georne,      and to dryhtne gebæd,
text.27: and his synna hord      selfa ontende,
text.29: weoruda dryhtne,      and ðus wordum spæc:
text.30: Miserere mei deus secundum magnam misericordiam tuam. "Miltsa ðu me, meahta walden,      nu ðu wast manna geðohtas,
text.34: Et secundum multitudinem miserationem tuarum dele iniquitatem meam. Ond eac efter menio      miltsa ðinra,
text.37: Amplius laua me ab iniustitia mea et a delicta mea munda mæ. Aðweah me of sennum,      saule fram wammum,
text.39: þa ðe ic on aldre      æfre gefremede
text.41: Quoniam iniquitatem meam ego agnosco et delictum meum coram me est semper. Forðan ic unriht min      eal oncnawe,
text.42: and eac synna gehwær      selfum æt eagan,
text.44: scelda scinað;      forgef me, sceppen min,
text.46: Tibi soli peccaui et malum coram te feci ut iustificeris in sermonibus tuis et uincas dum iudicaris. Nu ic anum ðe      oft syngode,
text.48: gelta gramhegdig,      ic ðe, gasta breogo,
text.53: ðæt ðu ne wilnast      weora æniges deað;
text.56: and hiom lif mid ðe      langsum begeton,
text.59: Ecce enim iniquitatibus. Ic on unrihtum      eac ðan in synnum
text.60: geeacnod wæs.      ðu ðæt ana wast,
text.61: mæhtig dryhten,      hu me modor gebær
text.62: in scame and in sceldum;      forgef me, sceppend min,
text.63: ðæt ic fram ðæm synnum      selfa gecerre,
text.65: and ic selfa eac      sioððan beeode.
text.66: Ecce enim ueritatem. Ac ðu, selua god,      soð an lufast;
text.67: þy ic ðe mid benum      biddan wille
text.69: forðan ðu me uncuðe      eac ðan derne
text.72: ðu me, meahtig god,      milde and bliðe
text.75: and eac ofer snawe      self scinende
text.77: Auditui meo dabis gaudium. Ontyn nu, elmehtig,      earna hleoðor,
text.79: on gefean bliðse      forðweard to ðe;
text.80: ðanne bioð on wenne,      waldend, simle
text.82: ða þe on hænðum ær      hwile wæron.
text.83: Auerte faciem tuam a peccatis meis et omnes. Ahwerf nu fram synnum,      saula neriend,
text.88: Cor mundum crea in me deus et spiritum rectum. æc ðu, dryhten Crist,      clene hiortan
text.89: in me, mehtig god,      modswiðne geðanc
text.92: and ðu rihtne gast,      rodera waldend,
text.94: Ne proicias me a facie tuae et spiritum sanctum tuum. Ne aweorp ðu me,      weoruda dryhten,
text.96: ne ðane godan fram me      gast haligne
text.99: Redde mihi letitiam. Sæle nu bliðse me,      bilewit dominus,
text.103: ðæt ic aldorlice      a forð sioððan
text.105: Doceam iniquos uias tuas et impii ad te. Simle ic ðine weogas      wanhogan lærde,
text.108: god selfa, to ðe      gastes mundberd
text.111: Befreo me an ferðe,      fæder mancynnes,
text.117: Domine labia mea aperies et os meum adnuntiauit. Ontyn nu, waldend god,      weoloras mine;
text.118: swa min muð sioððan      mæhte ðine
text.119: and lof georne      liodum to bliðse,
text.121: Quoniam si uoluisses. Ic ðe onsegednesse      sona brohte,
text.122: weoruda dryhtne,      ðer ðu wolde swa,
text.123: ða ðu þæt ne lufedest,      lifes bretta,
text.126: Sacrificium deo spiritus contribulatus. Ac ðe micle ma,      mehtig dryhten,
text.130: ða ðu, ælmæhtig,      æfre ne æwest.
text.131: Benigne fact domine in bona uoluntate. Gedoo nu fræmsume      frofre ðine
text.137: Swa þu, frea meahtig,      anfehst siþðan
text.139: hælend manna;      hio ðæt halige cealf
text.144: þa ðe ic on ælde      uel on giogeðe
text.150: þæt hine mehtig god      mannum to frofre
text.155: ða ðe he on ferðe      gefremed hæfde,
text.156: gastes wunde.      Forgef us, god mæahtig,
text.157: þæt we synna hord      simle oferwinnan
